titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: James W. Laurie (1903-1970) was born in Bellingham, Washington. His father and grandfather were Presbyterian ministers, as was his son, James Robertson Laurie. Laurie attended Coe College (1920-1924) and Princeton Theological Seminary(1924-1927), receiving a bachelor of divinity degree. He was ordained by the Presbytery of Elizabeth in 1926. Laurie was a pastor at the Second Presbyterian Church in Rahway, New Jersey from 1927-1936, at the Second Presbyterian Church in Wilkinsburg, Pennsylvania from 1936-1941, and Buffalo Central New York Church from 1941-1951. He was named President of Trinity University in 1951. Thomas J. Wilbanks (b. 1890) was the Stated Clerk of Paris Presbytery, Synod of Texas. He was Pastor of Pine Street Presbyterian Church, Texarkana, Texas, from 1925-1958 and chairman of Synod of Texas Historical Society at Trinity University, 1958-1965.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the personal and working papers of James W. Laurie (prior to 1951), those of his father, James A. Laurie, Jr., and of his grandfather, James A. Laurie. The collection also includes the correspondence of Mrs. James W. Laurie (Sarah B.). Included are addresses, sermons and sermon notes (1915-1960s); papers related to his ministries at Rahway and Buffalo, including minutes, programs, bulletins, correspondence, newsletters, and clippings; pocket diaries (1889-1928); photos and cyanotpyes; postcards; clippings; correspondence (1890s-1950s); Council on Theological Education minutes, financial records, and correspondence (1940s-1950s); and papers related to the General Assembly and General Council (1950s). Items from Laurie's time at Coe College include class notes, yearbooks, student papers, a debating handbook, and copies of the school newspaper, the Coe College Cosmos (1920s). There are also class notes from Princeton Theological Seminary (1926-1927) and typed drafts of a biography of Laurie by R. D. Brackenridge. The papers of James Anderson Laurie Jr. include correspondence and sermons; pocket diaries, and an 1896 commonplace book. The collection also includes: photocopies of 1864-1881 diaries of James A. Laurie; a typescript of boyhood memories, probably written by Laurie Sr.'s brother-in-law; a small collection of correspondence of Sarah B. Fiske Laurie; and some papers of Thomas Wilbanks. Most of the Wilbanks papers (1929-1960) relate to a dispute between the Cumberland Presbyterian Church and the Presbyterian Church U.S.A. over title to a 5 acre tract of land in Texas (1936-1939). Other materials include the T. J. Wilbanks collection of church bulletins and special programs and papers related to the Paris Presbytery.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Trinity University Library, Coiner Archives
